title: Drawing, "Study for Maximum Mass Permitted by the 1916 New York Zoning Law, Stage 3", 1922
medium: Black crayon, stumped and erased; brush and black wash over photostat, varnish, on illustration board
inscribed: In black crayon, verso: Ferriss/ 101 Park Av/ N.Y./ USA
description: Rendering of very dark, monumental high-rise building complex with tall set back central tower, flanked by two shorter towers, each with setback upper stories that form a pyramid-shaped tops.  Background shaded with cross-hatching to create a halo effect behind the building complex in the foreground.

exhibitions.title: Nancy and Edwin Marks Collection Gallery: Treasures from the Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study for Maximum Mass Permitted by the 1916 New York Zoning Law, Stage 3", 1922.
1922. Black crayon, stumped and erased; brush and black wash over photostat, varnish, on illustration board. Gift of Mrs. Hugh Ferriss. 1969-137-3.
